public interface SwaggerPathProvider

Method Summary
 String getApiResourcePrefix()
          e.g the api endpoint resides at http://myapp.com:8080//api/v1/businesses Should return /api/v1 - note the leading and non trailing forward slashes

Method Detail

getApiResourcePrefix

String getApiResourcePrefix()
e.g the api endpoint resides at http://myapp.com:8080//api/v1/businesses Should return /api/v1 - note the leading and non trailing forward slashes

Returns:
the resource prefix of the api endpoint

getAppBasePath

String getAppBasePath()
return the absolute path to the app/web server hosting the swagger documentation swagger ui doesn't handle relative uri's correctly plus swagger code gen needs absolute uris e.g. http://127.0.0.1:8080 https://mywebserver.com

Returns:
the applications base uri

sanitizeRequestMappingPattern

String sanitizeRequestMappingPattern(String requestMappingPattern)
Gets a uri friendly path from a request mapping pattern. Typically involves removing any regex patterns or || conditions from a spring request mapping This method will be called to resolve every request mapping endpoint. A good extension point if you need to alter endpoints by adding or removing path segments. Note: this should not be an absolute uri

Parameters:
requestMappingPattern -
Returns:
the request mapping endpoint
